00057 /*******************************************************************************
00058  **************************   GLOBAL FUNCTIONS   *******************************

00061 /***************************************************************************/
00075 void WDOG_Enable(bool enable)
00076 {
00077   if (!enable)
00078   {
00079     /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to have been completed in */
00080     /* low frequency domain */
00081     while (WDOG->SYNCBUSY & WDOG_SYNCBUSY_CTRL)
00082       ;
00083   }
00084   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(WDOG->CTRL), _WDOG_CTRL_EN_SHIFT, enable);
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 /***************************************************************************/
00097 void WDOG_Feed(void)
00098 {
00099   /* The watchdog should not be fed while it is disabled */
00100   if ( !(WDOG->CTRL & WDOG_CTRL_EN) )
00101   {
00102     return;
00103   }
00104 
00105   /* If a previous clearing is being synchronized to LF domain, then there */
00106   /* is no point in waiting for it to complete before clearing over again. */
00107   /* This avoids stalling the core in the typical use case where some idle loop */
00108   /* keeps clearing the watchdog. */
00109   if (WDOG->SYNCBUSY & WDOG_SYNCBUSY_CMD)
00110   {
00111     return;
00112   }
00113   /* Before writing to the WDOG_CMD register we also need to make sure that
00114    * any previous write to WDOG_CTRL is complete. */
00115   while ( WDOG->SYNCBUSY & WDOG_SYNCBUSY_CTRL )
00116     ;
00117 
00118   WDOG->CMD = WDOG_CMD_CLEAR;
00119 }
00120 
00121 
00122 /***************************************************************************/
00137 void WDOG_Init(const WDOG_Init_TypeDef *init)
00138 {
00139   uint32_t setting;
00140 
00141   if (init->enable)
00142   {
00143     setting = WDOG_CTRL_EN;
00144   }
00145   else
00146   {
00147     setting = 0;
00148   }
00149 
00150   if (init->debugRun)
00151   {
00152     setting |= WDOG_CTRL_DEBUGRUN;
00153   }
00154 
00155   if (init->em2Run)
00156   {
00157     setting |= WDOG_CTRL_EM2RUN;
00158   }
00159 
00160   if (init->em3Run)
00161   {
00162     setting |= WDOG_CTRL_EM3RUN;
00163   }
00164 
00165   if (init->em4Block)
00166   {
00167     setting |= WDOG_CTRL_EM4BLOCK;
00168   }
00169 
00170   if (init->swoscBlock)
00171   {
00172     setting |= WDOG_CTRL_SWOSCBLOCK;
00173   }
00174 
00175   setting |= ((uint32_t)(init->clkSel)   << _WDOG_CTRL_CLKSEL_SHIFT)
00176              | ((uint32_t)(init->perSel) << _WDOG_CTRL_PERSEL_SHIFT);
00177 
00178   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to have been completed in */
00179   /* low frequency domain */
00180   while (WDOG->SYNCBUSY & WDOG_SYNCBUSY_CTRL)
00181     ;
00182 
00183   WDOG->CTRL = setting;
00184 
00185   /* Optional register locking */
00186   if (init->lock)
00187   {
00188     if (init->enable)
00189     {
00190       WDOG_Lock();
00191     }
00192     else
00193     {
00194       BUS_RegBitWrite(&(WDOG->CTRL), _WDOG_CTRL_LOCK_SHIFT, 1);
00195     }
00196   }
00197 }
00198 
00199 
00200 /***************************************************************************/
00218 void WDOG_Lock(void)
00219 {
00220   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to have been completed in */
00221   /* low frequency domain */
00222   while (WDOG->SYNCBUSY & WDOG_SYNCBUSY_CTRL)
00223     ;
00224 
00225   /* Disable writing to the control register */
00226   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(WDOG->CTRL), _WDOG_CTRL_LOCK_SHIFT, 1);
00227 }
